FuncDef:
The spatial-multicast bandwidth command sets the bandwidth based on which load balancing is performed for Layer 3 flows of a specified or all VPN instances in a spatial multicast scenario.
The undo spatial-multicast command restores the default setting.
The default value is 3000 kbit/s for each Layer 3 flow.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.The specified VPN instance must have been created.

Specifies a multicast group address.
The value ranges from 224.0.0.0 to 239.255.255.255, in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask length of a multicast group address.
The value is an integer ranging from 4 to 32.

Specifies a multicast source address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the bandwidth based on which load balancing is performed for Layer 3 flows.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 30000000, in kbit/s.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In a spatial multicast scenario, Layer 3 flows are balanced among SFUs. To set the bandwidth based on which load balancing is performed for Layer 3 flows, run the spatial-multicast vpn-instance bandwidth command.
If the group-address or source-address parameter is specified, the command configuration takes effect only for the Layer 3 multicast flow with the specified address.
Precautions
The actual forwarding capability depends on the board forwarding capability. Therefore, setting bandwidth to a value same as or approximate to the actual traffic volume is recommended.A maximum of 1000 spatial-multicast vpn-instance bandwidth command instances are supported.This command is supported only on the admin VS.
